required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Dried Blood Spot Thyroglobulin and Urinary Iodine Concentration in Pregnant Women
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Dried Blood Spot Thyroglobulin in Pregnant Women to Redefine the Range of Median Urinary Iodine Concentration That Indicates Adequate Iodine Intake

brief_summary.textblock: To avoid iodine deficiency and its consequences in pregnant women and their offspring, women should reach a sufficient iodine intake long before conception. To monitor iodine status, median urinary iodine concentration (UIC) is widely used in pregnant women (PW). Thyroglobulin (Tg) us another marker used to assess iodine status . In this study, urine samples as well as dried blood spots will be collected to measure UIC and Tg (as well as other hormones to define thyroid function) in PW. The results shall be used to reassess the threshold which defines iodine status in PW according to UIC.

primary_outcome.measure: Urinary iodine concentration and Thyroglobulin concentration in pregnant women.
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of urine and blood samples to find urinary iodine concentration and Thyroglobulin concentration of each participant.

arm_group.description: Pregnant women which are suspected to have mild to moderate iodine deficiency but are otherwise health and living in the Lebanon.
Pregnant women which are suspected to have mild to moderate iodine deficiency but are otherwise health and living in Thailand.
Pregnant women which are suspected to have mild to moderate iodine deficiency but are otherwise health and living in South Africa.
Pregnant women which are suspected to have mild to moderate iodine deficiency but are otherwise health and living in New Zealand.
Pregnant women which are suspected to have mild to moderate iodine deficiency but are otherwise health and living in Sweden.
Pregnant women which are suspected to have mild to moderate iodine deficiency but are otherwise health and living in Peru.

intervention.description: this is a completely observational study, NO INTERVENTION

study_pop.textblock: Healthy pregnant women aged from 18 to 44 years, living since 12 months or longer in the respective country.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Generally healthy
2. No major medical illness, no thyroid disease, and taking no chronic medication
3. No use of iodine containing dietary supplements
4. No use of iodine-containing X-ray /CT contrast agent or iodine containing medication within the last year
5. Aged between 18 and 44 at enrollment
6. Singleton pregnancy
7. Non-smoking
8. Residence at study site since 12 months or longer
